intro: Cerastium pseudokasbek, commonly known as the Kazakh chickweed, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Cerastium pseudokasbek thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
